channel.title: CVE Feed for gaizhenbiao -- gaizhenbiao/chuanhuchatgpt
channel.description: The latest CVEs for gaizhenbiao -- gaizhenbiao/chuanhuchatgpt

item.title: CVE-2024-4321|2024-05-16T09:03:46.604Z -- gaizhenbiao -- gaizhenbiao/chuanhuchatgpt
item.description: A Local File Inclusion (LFI) vulnerability exists in the gaizhenbiao/chuanhuchatgpt application, specifically within the functionality for uploading chat history. The vulnerability arises due to improper input validation when handling file paths during the chat history upload process. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by intercepting requests and manipulating the 'name' parameter to specify arbitrary file paths. This allows the attacker to read sensitive files on the server, leading to information leakage, including API keys and private information. The issue affects version 20240310 of the application.

item.title: CVE-2024-2217|2024-04-16T11:10:32.139Z -- gaizhenbiao -- gaizhenbiao/chuanhuchatgpt
item.description: gaizhenbiao/chuanhuchatgpt is vulnerable to improper access control, allowing unauthorized access to the `config.json` file. This vulnerability is present in both authenticated and unauthenticated versions of the application, enabling attackers to obtain sensitive information such as API keys (`openai_api_key`, `google_palm_api_key`, `xmchat_api_key`, etc.), configuration details, and user credentials. The issue stems from the application's handling of HTTP requests for the `config.json` file, which does not properly restrict access based on user authentication.
